hypotheses.prediction: IF isolated mitochondria are exposed to 1-3 MHz ultrasound at 0.1-3 W/cm² ISPTA in degassed buffer (cavitation suppressed), THEN Laurdan generalized polarization (GP) of the OMM will change by <0.02 GP units (within noise), compared to >0.05 GP shift with positive control MβCD cholesterol depletion.
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Isolate mitochondria from HeLa cells by differential centrifugation, load with Laurdan (5 μM, 30 min). Expose in degassed vs. non-degassed PBS to pulsed US (1 MHz and 3 MHz, 0.5/1.0/3.0 W/cm², 60s) using a calibrated transducer with hydrophone verification. Image Laurdan GP by two-photon microscopy immediately pre/post. Parallel samples with 5 mM MβCD (30 min) as positive control. Timeline: 2 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: No significant Laurdan GP change in degassed conditions at any intensity; possible GP shift (>0.03) only in non-degassed samples at ≥1 W/cm² (cavitation-dependent). MβCD positive
hypotheses.null_outcome: Significant GP change (>0.03) in degassed samples, indicating direct mechanical coupling independent of cavitation.
controls: heat-matched control (water bath to US-equivalent ΔT)

hypotheses.prediction: IF isolated mitochondria are exposed to 40 kHz ultrasound at 1-3 W/cm² in air-saturated buffer, THEN OMM lipid domain reorganization (Laurdan GP decrease >0.05 and cholesterol-filipin puncta dispersal >30%) will occur; this effect will be abolished (>80% reduction) in degassed buffer.
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Isolate mitochondria from HeLa/HEK293 cells. Expose to 40 kHz US (0.5, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0 W/cm², 30-120s pulsed) in degassed (<1 mg/L O₂) or air-saturated buffer. Monitor cavitation via broadband noise (passive cavitation detector). Fix immediately, stain with filipin (cholesterol) and NAO (cardiolipin), image by structured illumination microscopy. Assess membrane integrity via cytochrome c release ELISA. Timeline: 3 weeks.
hypotheses.null_outcome: Equal lipid reorganization in degassed and air-saturated conditions, indicating direct mechanical (non-cavitation) mechanism at kHz.
controls: digitonin (0.01%) as membrane permeabilization positive control

hypotheses.prediction: IF OMM cholesterol is depleted by MβCD (5-10 mM, 30 min), THEN VDAC1 oligomerization (measured by EGS crosslinking and VDAC1-FRET) will increase >2-fold relative to vehicle, with concurrent loss of VDAC1 honeycomb clustering (>40% decrease in cluster size by STORM).
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Treat HEK293 and HeLa cells with MβCD (0, 1, 2.5, 5, 10 mM, 30 min, 37°C). For crosslinking: isolate mitochondria, treat with EGS (0.5 mM, 30 min), quench, run SDS-PAGE/Western for VDAC1 (monomer ~32 kDa, dimer ~64 kDa, oligomers >96 kDa). For FRET: transfect VDAC1-mCerulean + VDAC1-mVenus, measure FRET efficiency by acceptor photobleaching. For clustering: fix, immunostain VDAC1, image by STORM. Verify cholesterol depletion by Amplex Red assay on isolated mitochondria. Timeline: 2 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: Dose-dependent increase in VDAC1 dimer/oligomer bands (>2-fold at 5 mM MβCD), increased FRET efficiency (>1.5-fold), decreased STORM cluster size (>40%), correlating with cholesterol depletion (>40%). Partial rescue by cholesterol repletion (cholesterol-MβCD complexes).
hypotheses.null_outcome: No change in VDAC1 oligomeric state or clustering despite >40% cholesterol depletion, refuting lipid-dependent VDAC1 state model.

hypotheses.prediction: IF cancer cells (MCF-7, HeLa) and matched normal cells (MCF-10A, HEK293) are exposed to graded mechanical perturbation (MβCD titration as lipid disruption proxy, or 40 kHz US with cavitation), THEN cancer cells will show a sharper sigmoidal dose-response curve for VDAC1 oligomerization (Hill coefficient >3 vs. <2 for normal cells) with a higher intensity threshold (EC50 ~1.3-2× that of normal cells), but greater maximal response.
